case_vignette: A 28-year-old male presents to trauma surgery clinic after undergoing an exploratory laparotomy, femoral intramedullary nail, and femoral artery vascular repair 3 months ago. He suffered multiple gunshot wounds as a victim of a drive-by shooting. He is progressing well with well-healed surgical incisions on examination. He states during his clinic visit that he has been experiencing 6 weeks of nightmares where he "relives the day he was shot." The patient also endorses 6 weeks of flashbacks to "the shooter pointing the gun at him" during the daytime as well. He states that he has had difficulty sleeping and cannot concentrate when performing tasks.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been having nightmares where I relive the day I was shot and flashbacks during the day when I see the shooter pointing the gun at me. I'm also having trouble sleeping and I can't concentrate on things I'm trying to do.
How old are you?
I am 28 years old.
Have you experienced any symptoms of hyperarousal, such as being easily startled, feeling tense or on edge, or having difficulty sleeping?
Yes, I've had difficulty sleeping.
Have you experienced these symptoms for more than a month?
Yes, I've been experiencing these symptoms for 6 weeks.
Do you have a history of any mental health conditions or have you taken any medications for mental health in the past?
No, I haven't mentioned any history of mental health conditions or taking medications for mental health.
Do any of your family members have a history of mental health conditions?
The case vignette doesn't provide information about my family's medical history.

Understood. Based on your symptoms of nightmares, flashbacks, difficulty sleeping, and trouble concentrating, along with the history of a traumatic event, it seems likely that you are experiencing **Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).**
